snippet.textDisplay:
Ohai! For a change a few personal words. My name is Philipp and I started this channel almost seven years ago – you don’t know my voice but you have heard my words because I write most of our scripts.

Oh boy. This was a hard video to make. Gratitude felt vaguely risky to do as a topic. It has this aura of cheap Instagram hashtag self help stuff.

Some of you will hate this video deeply, and the thought of that made me pretty anxious writing it. Gratitude was not supposed to be a video topic originally. Just like the Nihilism and Loneliness videos, the script was based on personal struggles and part of the process of dealing with them. And so it felt right to make gratitude a video too.

But Kurzgesagt is not a self help channel, so we'll keep this sort of content at roughly one or two per year.

We hope they are helpful to some of you.

If you care for my take on how to practice Gratitude, we made a Kurzgesagt Gratitude journal to combine the science with practical tips. https://shop.kurzgesagt.org/

Please note: You don’t need to buy this or anything else to practice gratitude – you only need a pen, a piece of paper and 5 minutes.

Thank you for watching our videos and reading this comment. Being able to do Kurzgesagt means a lot. To me and the whole team. – Philipp
snippet.textOriginal:

Oh boy. This was a hard video to make. Gratitude felt vaguely risky to do as a topic. It has this aura of cheap Instagram hashtag self help stuff. 

Some of you will hate this video deeply, and the thought of that made me pretty anxious writing it. Gratitude was not supposed to be a video topic originally. Just like the Nihilism and Loneliness videos, the script was based on personal struggles and part of the process of dealing with them. And so it felt right to make gratitude a video too.

But Kurzgesagt is not a self help channel, so we'll keep this sort of content at roughly one or two per year. 

We hope they are helpful to some of you. 

If you care for my take on how to practice Gratitude, we made a Kurzgesagt Gratitude journal to combine the science with practical tips. https://shop.kurzgesagt.org/

Please note: You don’t need to buy this or anything else to practice gratitude – you only need a pen, a piece of paper and 5 minutes. 

Thank you for watching our videos and reading this comment. Being able to do Kurzgesagt means a lot. To me and the whole team. – Philipp

snippet.textDisplay: PSA: if you can't seem to feel grateful about anything at all, even though you rationally know your life isn't that bad, you might be clinically depressed and no amount of practising gratitude or meditating will make that go away. It can help, but it's likely it won't be enough. Don't beat yourself up for failing to feel good. It's not your fault.
snippet.textOriginal: PSA: if you can't seem to feel grateful about anything at all, even though you rationally know your life isn't that bad, you might be clinically depressed and no amount of practising gratitude or meditating will make that go away. It can help, but it's likely it won't be enough. Don't beat yourself up for failing to feel good. It's not your fault.

snippet.textDisplay:
Indeed...when you have to eat a shit sandwich with sprinkles because some dweeb with a bunch of armed thugs took your real food...be grateful you still have something to eat, and that it has sprinkles.

This sounds less like an antidote to dissatisfaction, and more like an amorphous barrier to progress.

snippet.textDisplay:
Today I feel grateful for
1. Having sorted out positively a complicated situation with a close friend
2. The taste of the tee that I'm drinking
3. Always having food on my table no matter how difficult life was sometimes
4. Having people in my life that truly love me - or at least to feel it that way
And 5. For always trying to be a better Man no matter how big the mistakes of my past look like

Thanks a lot, wish you all a nice day!

snippet.textDisplay: I feel more alone and empty now watching this video . Hello my name is Sid and i am sharing this with you guys that i am having no job for last year even after so many applications . I was rejected and this has caused misery in my life that as time is bypassing . Chances of securing job is getting low and low. I dont have bank balance either and my relationship is a long distance relationship. I live with my parents and when i write this comment i feel heavy at heart to express my self and what i really desire in life. I had a goal to travel around countries but this cost money and i dont know what else will get me money if i dont have a job. I feel empty at heart and alone in my world . What is friend ? I hardly remember now . I recently got scammed at least 3 times and things are worse  for me at my stage. The only thoughts that strike to me is should suicide is the only way to come out of this or should i wait ?

snippet.textDisplay: This is wonderful! Bravo! ❤

snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you for making and publishing this video. For some time I’ve been debating on whether to start a diary to note down the things that went well during my day, and your video gave me that last push to actually go for it.
It’s true, gratitude has been very overhyped in the social media, however by staying true to the scientific research I think you succeeded once again in making a video relevant for quite some of your viewers. Hope you have a nice day!
snippet.textOriginal:
Thank you for making and publishing this video. For some time I’ve been debating on whether to start a diary to note down the things that went well during my day, and your video gave me that last push to actually go for it. 
It’s true, gratitude has been very overhyped in the social media, however by staying true to the scientific research I think you succeeded once again in making a video relevant for quite some of your viewers. Hope you have a nice day!

snippet.textDisplay: I know you said that this not a self-help channel, but man! I really love your introspective/philosophical videos, even more than I love those about the universe or scientific facts. The egg, Beauty, Loneliness, Optimistic Nihilism are so deep and thought provoking, they let me reflecting a lot and I feel like they open a new standpoint which I didn't know. I hope you keep doing these videos more often despite the clarification.

After a difficult breakup a few months ago, I began to tweet various things (about something I ate or I discovered recently for example) just to change my mind, even though I don't have many followers.
With this video I realize that I began some kind of gratitude journaling, and it makes me want to continue in that way.
Full of gratitude towards you

snippet.textDisplay: I greatly respect how well Kurzgesagt handled selling their own merch. Other channels (recently Yes Theory) sell overpriced branded merch. snippet.textDisplay: I understand that this is good and all but in my mind I sincerely want to enact revenge on those who have done unfair wrongs to me in the past,l. Not with senseless violence, but usually with humiliation and the knowledge that they’ve done something wrong to others, only benefitting themselves and it wasn’t right to do. I sincerely desire this, more than wanting to be happy or to break down crying with empathy and forgiveness to myself or others. What is to be done with the anger and resentment? I feel like it doesn’t deserve to be just shunned away like an underserving thing. I can’t get over the anger at other people and myself at a pained life. I wish someone could answer this for me because it’s been years and I’m no different.

snippet.textDisplay:
For the cynics undoubtedly screaming at the video because they're forced to wrestle with a positive perspective,
the narrator essentially says to:
"Be more mindful of the good and useful things and people you have in life, because you wouldn't survive without them"
Thus you can draw your satisfaction in the simple acts of day to day life as you commit and bear witness to others doing the same.
"Take time to actually enjoy living instead of attempting to hurl yourself unflinchingly into an illusory abstract goal of success or progress with no accounting for your efforts"
Remembering what it took to get what you have and meet whom you've met allows you to properly appreciate how much it means that you have done so.
So the word Grateful comes up in the video, deal with it's presumptuous nature or get over yourself and see past the phrasing and into the authors intent:
Attempting to give some of his audience a mental tool to make life more bearable.
So be satisfied with what you have you ungrateful bastards, it could always be worse.
snippet.textOriginal:
For the cynics undoubtedly screaming at the video because they're forced to wrestle with a positive perspective, 
the narrator essentially says to:
"Be more mindful of the good and useful things and people you have in life, because you wouldn't survive without them"
Thus you can draw your satisfaction in the simple acts of day to day life as you commit and bear witness to others doing the same.
"Take time to actually enjoy living instead of attempting to hurl yourself unflinchingly into an illusory abstract goal of success or progress with no accounting for your efforts"
Remembering what it took to get what you have and meet whom you've met allows you to properly appreciate how much it means that you have done so. 
So the word Grateful comes up in the video, deal with it's presumptuous nature or get over yourself and see past the phrasing and into the authors intent:
Attempting to give some of his audience a mental tool to make life more bearable.
So be satisfied with what you have you ungrateful bastards, it could always be worse.

snippet.textDisplay: A message for those out there struggling. You are SO WORTH IT! Don’t give up, even when there seems like there is no light, no hope. It’s ok if you give up for,a day, or a week. But get back on that horse, you are worthy and valid and enough simply because you exist. I still struggle every single day but I’ve put in so much work over the last several years. Life CAN get better. Its lonely, it’s long, it’s hard, it’s painful, it’s not fair, you have to do the work, no one else can, but you are worth every inch of the struggle! I see you. Work towards seeing yourself.
snippet.textOriginal: A message for those out there struggling. You are SO WORTH IT! Don’t give up, even when there seems like there is no light, no hope. It’s ok if you give up for,a day, or a week.
